mechanics.name: mechanic label
mechanics.how_it_works: plain-language explanation

sections.title: Survival & Hydration
sections.overview: Hydration governs stamina recovery and overall survivability; sunstroke accelerates water loss.
key_points: Traveling during the day increases water consumption due to heat exposure.
Night runs and shade management reduce sunstroke and water burn.
Stillsuits slow evaporation; better suits noticeably extend range.
Literjons and water-processing stations cover most early hydration needs.

mechanics.name: Hydration Loop
mechanics.how_it_works: Carry Literjons, fill at base or hubs, and refill on every return trip.

mechanics.name: Sunstroke
mechanics.how_it_works: Heat exposure adds a debuff that raises water burn; plan travel during cooler hours.

mechanics.name: Water Stations
mechanics.how_it_works: Windtraps and purifiers convert inputs into potable water; keep filters and power steady.

mechanics.name: Trip Planning
mechanics.how_it_works: Stage a water cache at or near your base exit to reduce prep time.

warnings: Ignoring sunstroke can lead to rapid dehydration during fights or sprints.
notes: Route long paths across rock where possible to combine safety and lower water use.

sections.title: Heat & Exposure
sections.overview: Heat impacts stamina, hydration, and combat tempo; managing exposure keeps you mobile.
key_points: Direct sun raises consumption; shade and night travel mitigate it.
Climbing and sprinting under heat burn water faster than walking on rock.
Regroup on plateaus to clear debuffs before crossing another dune.
Equipment upgrades (suits, containers) multiply how far you can go.

mechanics.name: Heat Windows
mechanics.how_it_works: Plan objectives to align with the cooler parts of the day.

mechanics.name: Cooldown Spots
mechanics.how_it_works: Use overhangs, caves, and hub structures to reset exposure.

mechanics.name: Pacing
mechanics.how_it_works: Alternate sprints with short walks to prevent cascading resource drain.

mechanics.name: Stacking Effects
mechanics.how_it_works: Heat + combat + climbing compounds water loss—avoid doing all three at once.

sections.title: Sandworms
sections.overview: Worms punish time spent on deep sand; the vibration meter indicates risk.
key_points: The meter rises with movement, fights, vehicles, and harvesting on dunes.
Rock neutralizes vibration; plateaus are safe staging points.
Breaches are telegraphed; change course immediately when spikes occur.
Air or rock breaks contact; straight-line sprints across dunes rarely work.

mechanics.name: Meter Reading
mechanics.how_it_works: Treat high readings as a hard stop—pivot to rock rather than outrunning a breach.

mechanics.name: Route Design
mechanics.how_it_works: Leapfrog between rock spines; avoid long, flat sand corridors.

mechanics.name: Vehicle Use
mechanics.how_it_works: Vehicles amplify vibration; chain short bursts between rocks.

mechanics.name: Travel Timing
mechanics.how_it_works: Night travel reduces heat load so you can focus on managing vibration.

warnings: Crossing sand during spikes risks losing carried items if you cannot retrieve them.

sections.title: Sandwalking (Player-Discovered)
sections.overview: Some players report night-time traversal methods that reduce worm triggers using careful footing and traversal tools.
key_points: Softstep‑style footwear and grappling can help shorten exposed segments.
Performed well, long crossings are possible without a breach.
Execution is sensitive to terrain and timing.
As an emergent technique, behavior can change with patches.

mechanics.name: Footwork
mechanics.how_it_works: Short, deliberate steps and controlled movement minimize vibration during crossings.

mechanics.name: Grapples
mechanics.how_it_works: Use grapples to skip the longest sand stretches between rocks.

mechanics.name: Night Advantage
mechanics.how_it_works: Lower heat at night lets you manage hydration while focusing on footing.

mechanics.name: Contingency
mechanics.how_it_works: Always maintain a bailout path to nearby rock.

notes: If a patch alters traversal, re-test routes before committing to long runs.

sections.title: Coriolis Storms
sections.overview: Region-spanning sandstorms reduce visibility and damage exposed structures and players.
key_points: Storms punish foundations placed directly on sand.
Shielded, rock-anchored bases take far less damage.
Shelter planning is essential for long routes.
Power outages during storms cascade into water outages.

mechanics.name: Forecasting
mechanics.how_it_works: Carry enough water to hold position until the storm passes.

mechanics.name: Base Hardening
mechanics.how_it_works: Place critical structures within shield coverage on rock.

mechanics.name: Travel Abort
mechanics.how_it_works: Turn back to your previous plateau if visibility drops and vibration rises.

mechanics.name: Recovery
mechanics.how_it_works: Repair structures promptly to prevent deferred damage from compounding.

warnings: Traveling blind into open dunes during storms often ends in worm or exposure deaths.

sections.title: Visibility & Navigation
sections.overview: Dust and storm conditions obscure landmarks; clean routing prevents panic detours.
key_points: Use map waypoints to string safe plateaus together.
Avoid featureless flats where orientation is easy to lose.
Mark shelters and refuel points during clear weather.
Do not cross vast dunes in low visibility unless necessary.

mechanics.name: Landmarks
mechanics.how_it_works: Memorize silhouettes of ridgelines and hub towers for quick bearings.

mechanics.name: Backstops

mechanics.name: Breadcrumbs
mechanics.how_it_works: Set interim waypoints near resource nodes to aid later loops.

mechanics.name: Route Discipline
mechanics.how_it_works: Resist ‘just this once’ shortcuts across open sand.

Keep it powered; shield coverage reduces environmental damage.
Rock placement shortens cable runs and reduces storm risk.
Re‑placement is possible but plan for downtime and power.

mechanics.how_it_works: Equip Construction Tool → place Console → wire power → expand stations.

mechanics.name: Shielding

mechanics.name: Center Mass
mechanics.how_it_works: Anchor console and generators centrally to maximize coverage.

mechanics.name: Relocation
mechanics.how_it_works: Stagger teardown so critical services remain online.

sections.title: Base Foundations

Short cable runs are easier to maintain under pressure.
Consolidated layouts are cheaper to defend and repair.
Spread-out mini-bases multiply failure points.

mechanics.name: Choke Points

mechanics.name: Service Aisles

mechanics.name: Upgrade Path
mechanics.how_it_works: Reserve central plots for bigger stations you’ll unlock later.

sections.title: Cabling & Lines
sections.overview: Power and water lines are your base’s arteries; keep routes short and covered.
key_points: Cable only what you must; excess line length increases troubleshooting time.
Run water lines directly into cisterns to buffer outages.
Shielded routes reduce damage during storms.
Label mentally where mains and branches run.

mechanics.name: Critical Split
mechanics.how_it_works: Place water systems on a small independent feed to survive brownouts.

mechanics.name: Storm Checks
mechanics.how_it_works: Inspect mains after every storm before resuming long crafts.

mechanics.name: Access
mechanics.how_it_works: Keep lines visible enough to diagnose breaks quickly.

sections.title: Storage & Logistics

Isolate consumables: filters, fuel cells, repair kits near their stations.
Overflow cisterns reduce micromanagement during outages.
Keep a departures cache near your base exit.

mechanics.name: Output Bins

mechanics.name: Audit

mechanics.name: Primary/Overflow

mechanics.name: Shielding

mechanics.name: Power Budget
mechanics.how_it_works: Size power to keep water online during peak crafting.

sections.title: Generators vs Turbines
sections.overview: Fuel generators provide predictable output; turbines pair well with Windtraps for low‑maintenance grids.
key_points: Generators cost fuel but ignore weather fluctuations.
Turbines save fuel and pair naturally with water production.
A hybrid grid reduces single‑point failures.

mechanics.name: Hybrid Layout
mechanics.how_it_works: Put water on the renewable leg and heavy crafts on the fueled leg.

mechanics.name: Redundancy
mechanics.how_it_works: Split critical lines so a single outage doesn’t halt everything.

mechanics.name: Maintenance
mechanics.how_it_works: Inspect turbines after storms and check generator fuel before long crafts.

sections.title: Research Menu Modes

key_points: Locked surfaces nodes as you progress through story and tutorials.
Unlocked shows the entire tree so you can plan freely.
Neither changes total costs; it’s a pacing preference.
